Reviews.Content: Great!!! I wish we could have stayed here both nights but they were booked. This was a very nice hotel. Great view, nice front desk. They kept our luggage for us for 4 days no charge. Great location. We really enjoyed this hotel compared toa couple different hotels we had stayed in, in Japan.
Reviews.Author: Emily94965

Reviews.Content: Comfortable and pleasant - great location! I just got back from a three-night stay at the Marunouchi Hotel, and I thought it was great. I was in Tokyo on business - the hotel was very convenient to the train station and my meetings. It was also very easy to get around the city by either subway or train, and the hotel was about a 5-10 minute walk from the Imperial Palace. I had access to the club floor with my room, so breakfast in the club lounge was included (it was fine - a basic breakfast of juice, cereal, sweet rolls, fruit, etc.). In addition to its close proximity to the train station, the hotel is in the same building as a number of restaurants, a huge bookstore (with many books in English) and a small drug/cosmetics store. It was perfect for a business trip and would be a good central location for a vacation. The basic rooms might be a little small for one person, but larger corner rooms and suites are available. The only reason I gave the hotel 4 stars is because there is no gym.
Reviews.Author: Jefinur

Reviews.Content: Oasis in Tokyo Just returned after 4 nights at the Marunouchi. It is an oasis of calm, peace and quiet in a crowded and noisy city. If you are arriving from Narita, either by train or aiport bus, you are immediately at the doorstep of the hotel. The hotel is new and tastefully decorated. Others have criticized the breakfast here. My wife and I found everything perfectly fresh and beautifully presented.........a perfect way to start the day. Try the breakfast room on the 9th floor, it is surprisingly elegant. We travel to Tokyo yearly, have stayed at many hotels, and have finally found our home in Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: runslow_8

Reviews.Content: Perfectly acceptable Tokyo hotel This is the second time I have stayed here. I work for a Japanese company and I have to have the annual visit to HO, and they booked me here again.I found the staff, especially the front desk, very helpful and with excellent English - just as well as my Japanese runs out after Kampai!.The room was quite small, but clean and well equipped and with a very compact bathroom - but what else does one expect in Tokyo?? It was clean and perfectly functional. The toilet itself warrants special mention, more buttons and dials than a space shuttle...I do agree about the food, I have stayed there seven nights over two visits and was spectacularly underwhelmed by the Western breakfasts: I can't speak for the Japanese breakfasts as I don't take seafood or miso soup. The bar is appalling, but then it is a separate operation to the hotel. The bouncer was most upset that a non-Japanese wanted to go in and insisted on telling me about the 1,000 Yen cover charge - so what I said, I will charge it to expenses. I then told him which company I work for and his demeanour changed and I was allowed in. Once I got in and peered through the smog of cigar smoke at the drinks list I almost wished that I had not been allowed in. Luckily my drinks (and cover charge) did get lost in the eye-watering expenses claim that I submitted...Much better value for FB is to go to the Oazo building next door which has some good options and while not cheap, I'd say good value.The location is very handy for the trains and metro and the airport bus stops just outside so overall I would say it's totally acceptable as a hotel for me.
Reviews.Author: Rushman2112

Reviews.Content: Modern and stylist hotel in a great location I stayed in this hotel a couple of nights before I move to my new apartment. Somehow I got upgraded in a larger room in the corner of the building with an amazing view over the Tokyo Station railways. But it was not noisy at all. Room was great, very modern, zen decorated, you could just stay during the whole day in the room if you don't want to get out as it is very cosy. Concierge staff was great as they help you to find your way and even print your locations' maps for you. I had breakfast once in the main restaurant, but not very special. Downstairs is a main shopping mall with a huge bookstore and Tokyo station is at 2 min away.
Reviews.Author: Sophie_In_Taipei

Reviews.Content: Lovely This hotel is excellent value for money in Tokyo, I paid 拢150 a night for excellent service, a clean, chic, modern room, well equiped and very calming in such a mad city. It is well located across from Tokyo station if you plan to travel in and out of the city. The area is very quiet at night as business area but eating places in the centre itself as well as in the station. It was a great choice for me as respite but would probably be good to balance with another choice in Shibuya or Shinjuku.
Reviews.Author: Goldiemaciver

Reviews.Content: Good location but terrible facilities I consult for a Japanese company in Tokyo and they have put me up here for a week every six months since it has opened...I keep thinking after I arrive to change hotels....it's bearable as the location is good, but the breakfast is horrendous ...(strange for Japan where food and service are usually excellent) - at this place the a la carte food arrives cold and the items on the buffet keep running out - service is terribly slow....even in the over priced bar (which usually you can't get a seat at). The staff are helpful but really get in the way...(calling you at 1am to apologise for a shirt that wasn't delivered etc.)Also, with no swimming pool or gym, this is really just a place to sleep and head off elsewhere.For my next trip, I will stay elsewhere...
Reviews.Author: SimonDubai

Reviews.Content: 2 nights only so bearable... Spent 2 night there while in Tokyo on business... was a clean hotel, central. Other than that there is nothing to write home about. If you are looking for something cheap and efficient - this is it.
Reviews.Author: SSS2005

Reviews.Content: Great Location and Great Hotel       Hotel Bathroom
Reviews.Author: mkjr

Reviews.Content: Convenient Location Contrary to some other opinions, I enjoyed my stay at this property. My biggest difficulty was finding the entrance after being dropped off by the airport bus!The room was clean and very quiet with good internet access (a requirement for my work). The staff did their best to be helpful, including giving me maps and directing me to the train station ticket office for my reservations and purchases, navigating me to the stores of my choice- even calling to check the store hours. They also arranged to ship a suitcase ahead to another city.I didn't eat at the Western breakfast buffet as I prefer to eat local food while traveling. The Japanese breakfast was very tasty and sufficient. While not in the thick of things, the location directly above the train station suited my schedule and saved me a great deal of time every day.
Reviews.Author: GuanMiao

Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel I have Ever Stayed At I have travelled to many countries for my work (usually at 4-5 star hotels) and also for pleasure (usually at B+B's, backpackers, camp sites and budget hotels). I can honestly say that I have never been motivated to write a review. However, this hotel is a shocker and should be avoided.I stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks in August 2006. It is across the road from the Tokyo Railway Station and it is clean and 'chic'. However, it is ridiculously over priced, the food is a ridiculous brand of French mini meals at astronomical prices, drinks are unbelievably expensive and room service is a joke in terms of quality and choice. The breakfast menu is tiny and poor quality (I have eaten better quality food in a US$15 per night BB). There is no pool or gym. The rooms are small and the staff are slow and unresponsive.If I had paid for this hotel rather than my company, I would have walked about the first night. If you are going to spend US$200 鈥?US$300 per night for a hotel in Tokyo 鈥?stay at the Westin, Hyatt or Hilton (Hyatt is best).
Great Hotel in Tokyo       Marunouchi Hotel Lobby
Reviews.Author: rannyw

Reviews.Content: Lovely chic modern hoyel I was in Tokyo at another hotel in the outskirts and I wondered what had happened to the old Marunouchi Hotel which I had used many years earlier. Travelling on the Yamanote Line out of Tokyo Station I saw a building with Maruzen and Marunouchi on the sides. Maruzen was a large bookshop on Ginza which had also disappeared and there they were right opposite Tokyo Station. I immediately booked a single for two nights at my wife's instigation. It is beautiful but very modern and minimalist. The views over Tokyo Station are great and you can even see, but not hear, aircraft inbound to Haneda Airport.I loved it, the only proviso that I would mention is that the buffet breakfast is far from European size and variety. Go outside to the station area for a 'Morning Service' type meal. I will go back
Reviews.Author: Bernard Holley

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel This is a newly renovated hotel adjacent to the Tokyo Station. Very convenient location. Lobby and Rooms are comfortable with all western amenities. Free internet. Be wary of the Cigar Bar. They charge a sitting fee of about $10 per seat without advance warning. One round of drinks for 4 people cost me almost $80.
Reviews.Author: Febo17

Reviews.Content: Best choice in Tokyo This new Tokyo hotel is the perfect choice for any visitor (both tourists and business travelers) to Tokyo and Japan. I lived in Tokyo for 10 years and travel there frequently on business. The Marunouchi Hotel is a delightful place with a combination of style, quality, convenience and price that cannot be matched. It is located directly next to Tokyo Station, which means seamless transport from Narita Airport and to cities like Kyoto and Osaka: no taxis or subway rides with luggage. The hotel is connected to the beautiful Oazo shopping center with wonderful bakeries, restaurants and shops and is a short walk from more shopping, and the Ginza shopping district, which is about 10 minutes' walk. Having read through what I've written, it seems like a paid advertisement for this hotel - but it was that good. I will always use this hotel on future visits to Japan. I made my reservation through their website, and paid approx 23,000 yen per night, before tax.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
